snippet: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority of Los Angeles in May approved a nine-mile stretch of a project, at a cost of $5.6 billion, that would run under the high school campus.
abstract: Residents of Beverly Hills, Calif, have gone to court to block the proposed Subway to the Sea line from burrowing under the high school, which is celebrated for its roster of famous graduates and its ZIP code; suit contends that the tunnel poses a safety threat to students, but tensions have resurfaced between school officials and transit advocates, bringing to the surface, unfairly, Beverly Hills residents say, old charges that the community does not want to open its borders to mass transit.
lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority of Los Angeles in May approved a nine-mile stretch of a project, at a cost of $5.6 billion, that would run under the high school campus.

headline.seo: Subway Line Under Beverly Hills High Faces Roadblock
headline.main: Subway Line Meets an Obstruction: Beverly Hills High School
headline.print_headline: Subway Line Meets an Obstruction: Beverly Hills High School
